title.narrative: QUALITY AND EQUITABLE NUTRITION SERVICES

description.narrative: Law on Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH), immunization policy rosschecking of DRR policy documents, training and commodities to mitigate dzud and drought impact, which contributes to Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition (Covid), Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Micronutrients, Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition In Early Childhood (Covid), Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Nutrition â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the most disadvantaged children in Mongolia benefit from increased access to and utilization of services that promote health and nutrition, including Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) and interventions that mitigate the impact of air pollution on child survival.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Law on MNCH, immunization policy rosschecking of DRR policy documents, training and commodities to mitigate dzud anddrought impact

description.narrative: Nutrition programme continued critical support to Government during COVID-19 pandemic reaching 358,494 children under 5 nationwide. National protocol on Integrated Management of Acute Malnutrition was approved by the Health Minister’s Order A/379, enabling most vulnerable and severely malnourished children to access the early detection and adequate treatment.Acomprehensive landscape analysis was conducted on the situation of childhood obesity in Mongolia, informing the Government to draft the amendment of Advertisement Law.Standards of laboratoryanalytical methods of fortified flour, iodized salt and premix finalized,allowing food laboratories to issue valid results in the analysis of micronutrients in fortified food. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/12/2021
